medium: 13-R canal of E end of trench; 6/19/1936; Decorated bone fragment; the execution on the decorated side of this bone object is excellent while on the inner side it is merely smoothed and lined to give a firmer tread. The ends are both splintered one newly, the other an old break. Possibly part of a handle, or an overlay is beautifully incised with small diagonally run lines. 01 apart while the spaces in between are sloped making a small hollow or valley with gently sloping sides. The inside is barely smoothed with small horizontal lines.
creditline: Gift of the Committee for the Excavation of Antioch to Princeton University

texts.textentryhtml: Excavated by the Princeton-led team at Antioch-on-the-Orontes, present-day Antakya, Turkey, 1931-1939; with the Museum since 1939
texts.remarks: Batch edit for Provenance publication project

The ends are both splintered one newly, the other an old break. Possibly part of a handle, or an overlay is beautifully incised with small diagonally run lines. 01 apart while the spaces in between are sloped making a small hollow or valley with gently sloping sides. The inside is barely smoothed with small horizontal lines. Gift of the Committee for the Excavation of Antioch to Princeton University (Antioch 6181-b169)
